sen.j: 市司（いちのつかさ）は律令制日本の律令制において京職に属する機関。
sen.e: Ichi-no-tsukasa was the institution belonged to Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) of the Ritsuryo system Japan.

Ichi no tsukasa (Market Office) was the institution that belonged to Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) of the Ritsuryo system Japan.
sen.cmt: Ichi-no-tsukasaのハイフン消去、補足追加、institution belonged→institution that belongedに修正
sen.e: Ichi no tsukasa (Market Office) was the institution that belonged to Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) of the Ritsuryo system Japan.

sen.j: 都の東西の市場それぞれに設置され、東市司（ひがしのいちのつかさ）は左京職に西市司（にしのいちのつかさ）は右京職に属していた。
sen.e: It was placed in the each market east and west of the capital, and Higashi-no-ichi-no-tsukasa was belonged to Sakyoshiki (Eastern Capital Offices) and Nishi-no-ichi-no-tsukasa was belonged to Ukyoshiki (Western Capital Offices).

It was placed in the each market east and west of the capital, and Higashi no ichi no tsukasa (Office of the East Market) belonged to Sakyoshiki (Eastern Capital Offices) and Nish no ichi no tsukasa (Office of the West Market) belonged to Ukyoshiki (Western Capital Offices).
sen.cmt: Higashi-no-ichi-no-tsukasa、Nishi-no-ichi-no-tsukasaのハイフン消去、補足追加、was belonged→belongedに修正
sen.e: It was placed in the each market east and west of the capital, and Higashi no ichi no tsukasa (Office of the East Market) belonged to Sakyoshiki (Eastern Capital Offices) and Nish no ichi no tsukasa (Office of the West Market) belonged to Ukyoshiki (Western Capital Offices).

sen.j: 都の東西に置かれていた市を監督する。
sen.e: Supervised cities located east and west of the capital.
Supervised cities located east and west of the capital.
Supervised cities located east and west of the capital.

sen.j: 市における不正及び犯罪の防止や交易における度量衡の管理、物価の監視などにあたる他、時に応じて公用に供する物資の調達にもあたったとされている。
sen.e: Prevented from fraud and crime in the cities, managed scales and measures on commerce, monitored prices, and worked on procurement of commodity for public use when necessary.
Prevented from fraud and crime in the cities, managed scales and measures on commerce, monitored prices, and worked on procurement of commodity for public use when necessary.
Prevented from fraud and crime in the cities, managed scales and measures on commerce, monitored prices, and worked on procurement of commodity for public use when necessary.

sen.j: また、10日ごとに（「延喜式」では毎月1度）市における時価を上中下の3等に分けた（その中でも更に高値安値などの3段階表記をしたため、実質は9等）。
sen.e: Also, divided prevailing price in the cities into 3 ranks as upper, middle, lower (each was described as 3 ranks further such as expensive or cheep, so it was actually 9 ranks) every 10 days (once a month in 'Engishiki' (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, divided prevailing price in the cities into three ranks as upper, middle, lower (each was described as three ranks further such as expensive or cheep, so it was actually nine ranks) every 10 days (once a month in the 'Engishiki' [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).
sen.cmt: 3, 9をスペルアウト、in the 'Engishiki'とし、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: Also, divided prevailing price in the cities into three ranks as upper, middle, lower (each was described as three ranks further such as expensive or cheep, so it was actually nine ranks) every 10 days (once a month in the 'Engishiki' [an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

sen.j: そして、その時々の物価を調査した「估価帳」を作成して属する京職に対して提出した。
sen.e: Then, 'Kokacho' (price book) that stated investigated prices at different times and submitted to the belonged Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, Ichi no tsukasa prepared 'Kokacho' (price book) that stated investigated prices at different times and submitted to Kyoshiki it belonged to.
sen.cmt: Then, 'Kokacho'→Then, Ichi no tsukasa prepared 'Kokacho'、the belonged Kyoshiki→Kyoshiki it belonged toとし、既出のためKyoshikiの補足削除
sen.e: Then, Ichi no tsukasa prepared 'Kokacho' (price book) that stated investigated prices at different times and submitted to Kyoshiki it belonged to.

sen.j: 長である市正（いちのかみ）は本来は正六位上相当の官であったが、五位の実務官僚や得業生や文章生のうち成功 (任官)に応じた者が任命されることが多かった。
sen.e: Ichi no kami (Commissioner of the Market) as the head was originally an official equivalent to Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), but a person who accepted to have an appointment among governmental official of Goi (Fifth Rank) responsible for practical works, tokugyosho (student like postgraduate, student taking the graduate program) and monjosho (student of literary studies in the Imperial University) most of the time.

Ichi no kami (Commissioner of the Market) as the head was originally an official equivalent to Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), but a person who accepted to have an appointment among governmental official of Goi (Fifth Rank) responsible for practical works, tokugyosho (student like postgraduate, student taking the graduate program) and monjosho (student of literary studies in the Imperial University) most of the time.

Ichi no kami (Commissioner of the Market) as the head was originally an official equivalent to Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), but a person who accepted to have an appointment among governmental official of Goi (Fifth Rank) responsible for practical works, tokugyosho (student like postgraduate, student taking the graduate program) and monjosho (student of literary studies in the Imperial University) most of the time.

sen.j: つまり良くも悪くも財力や経済感覚に富んだ人物が起用されていた。
sen.e: It meant that a person who had assets and economic sense seemed to be appointed to the post in a positive and negative way.
It meant that a person who had assets and economic sense seemed to be appointed to the post in a positive and negative way.
It meant that a person who had assets and economic sense seemed to be appointed to the post in a positive and negative way.

sen.j: また、市の治安を扱う事から検非違使の尉が兼務することもあった。
sen.e: Also, Kebiishi no jo (Number three officials with judicial and police powers) was often appointed to the post since the post dealt with security in the cities.
Also, Kebiishi no jo (Number three officials with judicial and police powers) was often appointed to the post since the post dealt with security in the cities.
Also, Kebiishi no jo (Number three officials with judicial and police powers) was often appointed to the post since the post dealt with security in the cities.

sen.j: 伴部として価格を検査する価長、市での犯罪者を取り締まる物部などが置かれた。
sen.e: Kacho who inspected prices as tomobe (Servant of the Court administering a group) and monobe who cracked down on criminals in the cities were staffed.
Kacho who inspected prices as tomobe (Servant of the Court administering a group) and monobe who cracked down on criminals in the cities were staffed.
Kacho who inspected prices as tomobe (Servant of the Court administering a group) and monobe who cracked down on criminals in the cities were staffed.

sen.j: 正（正六位上相当）東西各一名
sen.e: Sho (equivalent to Shorokuinojo), one individual for east and west each.
Kami (equivalent to Shorokuinojo), one individual for east and west each.
Kami (equivalent to Shorokuinojo), one individual for east and west each.

sen.j: 佑（従七位下相当）東西各一名
sen.e: Jo (equivalent to Jushichiinoge (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade)), one individual for east and west each.
Jo (equivalent to Jushichiinoge [Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual for east and west each.
Jo (equivalent to Jushichiinoge [Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual for east and west each.

sen.j: 令史（大初位上相当）東西各一名
sen.e: Reishi (equivalent to daishoijo (Grater Initial Rank, Upper Grade)), one individual for east and west each.
Reishi (equivalent to Daihatsuinojo [Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade]), one individual for east and west each.
sen.cmt: daishoijo→Daihatsuinojoに修正、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: Reishi (equivalent to Daihatsuinojo [Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade]), one individual for east and west each.

sen.j: 史生 東西各二名（後各一名）
sen.e: Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents), two individuals for east and west each (later one for each).
Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents), two individuals for east and west each (later one for each).
Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents), two individuals for east and west each (later one for each).
Kacho, five individuals for east and west each.
Kacho, five individuals for east and west each.
Kacho, five individuals for east and west each.

sen.j: 物部 東西各二十名
sen.e: Monobe, 20 individuals for east and west each.
Monobe, 20 individuals for east and west each.
Monobe, 20 individuals for east and west each.

sen.j: 使部 東西各十名（後各六名）
sen.e: Shibu (low rank bureaucrats), 10 individuals for east and west each (later six for each).
Shibu (low rank bureaucrats), 10 individuals for east and west each (later six for each).
Shibu (low rank bureaucrats), 10 individuals for east and west each (later six for each).
Jikicho (factotum), one individual for east and west each.
Jikicho (factotum), one individual for east and west each.
